competitors.name: Tsunami Restaurant & Sushi Bar - Traverse Mountain

businessProfile.name: Padeli's Street Greek
businessProfile.address: 2975 Club House Dr, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 2975 Club House Dr, Lehi, UT 84043, USA

reviews.text:
I tried this place for the first time today and I highly recommend. The employees were very nice and the food was perfect!

I texted my family immediately after the first bite and told her she needs to try this place.

I‚Äôll be back for sure!

We came as a group of 6 and all got different variations of the Gyro with lamb and beef or chicken. The smoked red pepper tzatziki was great (a little spicy) and the lamb and beef were a little dry from sitting in the metal tins. I wish they fresh cut the meat! We all agreed the tzatziki sauce would have been better if it was under or mixed with the meat. Overall flavor was good with fresh toppings to choose from. The baklava was okay, nothing special but sweet. Would come back but would definitely mix that tzatziki in with the meat to help how dry it can get. The chicken was nice and moist though! I also think you should get more than 3 topping choices. I wanted lettuce too.

Absolutely delicious! 10/10! I got the lamb and beef gyro and it did not disappoint! I also tried the street fries for the first time and they were awesome! Fully loaded, perfect amount of spicy! The costumer service was great too!

I was pleasantly surprised with this place! The food was affordable and worth every penny. I had the street fries and loved them. The fries were made fresh and all the toppings were of excellent quality. The pita chips and hummus was also very good. Cool Greek spot in Lehi, I think I‚Äôll be back here again next time I need something light and fresh.

Got a side of meat with two toppings. I chose chicken and gyro meat. The chicken was thigh meat that still had quite a bit of fat throughout. The gyro meat was unremarkable and fairly bland compared to other Greek places'.  Both selections were cold despite being pulled from warming pans.
Staff was very helpful and friendly. They were both working hard. The person who was serving actually recommended the side option to make my pocketbook happy. I avoid carbs and the side was exactly perfect for what I needed for both nutritional value and size. My spouse got the house Gyro with chicken and Gyro as well. We arrived around 7 pm Nd they were in process of closing. Chairs were on tables, silverware etc restocked and they were mopping the floors. Staff was welcoming and kind and didn't make us feel like were in the way. I may give it another chance if I can get there earlier in the day. Would definitely not order the chicken again because it was fatty and dry. The food service area needed to be wiped up but things get messy when it's busy and perhaps they didn't have a chance to make it neat. The floor was sticky throughout the dining area despite watching it get mopped. Overall, the food was OK, the staff were kind and helpful.

recentReviews.text: This was our first time here and we had a great experience! The food was fresh and delicious with big portions. The customer service was top notch. We will definitely be back.

Love the soup and rice bowl combo. I have been a semi-regular customer now for several years and just love the relaxing atmosphere and great service and food. Totally one of my favorites in the valley and especially for the Greek food.
Dont accept cash!!! They happily made our compleat order then threw it away in front of us because they don't accept cash .  So waste of time and food zero stars
Fresh ingredients, excellent Gyro Meat, Tasty Chicken.
They always have the sliding door open in the summer and it gets hit inside.

We came as a group of 6 and all got different variations of the Gyro with lamb and beef or chicken. The smoked red pepper tzatziki was great (a little spicy) and the lamb and beef were a little dry from sitting in the metal tins. I wish they fresh cut the meat! We all agreed the tzatziki sauce would have been better if it was under or mixed with the meat. Overall flavor was good with fresh toppings to choose from. The baklava was okay, nothing special but sweet. Would come back but would definitely mix that tzatziki in with the meat to help how dry it can get. The chicken was nice and moist though! I also think you should get more than 3 topping choices. I wanted lettuce too.

detailedReviews.author: Jamie Schaible
detailedReviews.text: This was our first time here and we had a great experience! The food was fresh and delicious with big portions. The customer service was top notch. We will definitely be back.

detailedReviews.author: Grant Echols
detailedReviews.text: Love the soup and rice bowl combo. I have been a semi-regular customer now for several years and just love the relaxing atmosphere and great service and food. Totally one of my favorites in the valley and especially for the Greek food.

detailedReviews.author: Brice A
detailedReviews.text: Dont accept cash!!! They happily made our compleat order then threw it away in front of us because they don't accept cash .  So waste of time and food zero stars

detailedReviews.author: Christopher Zambos
detailedReviews.text: Fresh ingredients, excellent Gyro Meat, Tasty Chicken.

detailedReviews.author: meredith c
detailedReviews.text: They always have the sliding door open in the summer and it gets hit inside.

detailedReviews.author: Daniel Gonsalves
detailedReviews.text: We came as a group of 6 and all got different variations of the Gyro with lamb and beef or chicken. The smoked red pepper tzatziki was great (a little spicy) and the lamb and beef were a little dry from sitting in the metal tins. I wish they fresh cut the meat! We all agreed the tzatziki sauce would have been better if it was under or mixed with the meat. Overall flavor was good with fresh toppings to choose from. The baklava was okay, nothing special but sweet. Would come back but would definitely mix that tzatziki in with the meat to help how dry it can get. The chicken was nice and moist though! I also think you should get more than 3 topping choices. I wanted lettuce too.

detailedReviews.author: Ross H.
detailedReviews.text: It's surprisingly and consistently good. Get the lamb gyro.

detailedReviews.author: Jason V
detailedReviews.text: Did not provide the order I paid for.

detailedReviews.author: Hunter Smith
detailedReviews.text:
I tried this place for the first time today and I highly recommend. The employees were very nice and the food was perfect!

I texted my family immediately after the first bite and told her she needs to try this place.

I‚Äôll be back for sure!

detailedReviews.author: Kerisa Devey
detailedReviews.text: Very mediocre. Food lacked flavor and quality was mid. They also didn‚Äôt have ice which was a bummer.

detailedReviews.author: Radical Edward
detailedReviews.text: The ingredients were fresh and good quality. The actual meal was a bit lacking and bland, but not terrible. I would give it four stars, but the falafel I got was basically just raw batter inside of a crispy shell.

detailedReviews.author: Holly B
detailedReviews.text:
Got a side of meat with two toppings. I chose chicken and gyro meat. The chicken was thigh meat that still had quite a bit of fat throughout. The gyro meat was unremarkable and fairly bland compared to other Greek places'.  Both selections were cold despite being pulled from warming pans.
Staff was very helpful and friendly. They were both working hard. The person who was serving actually recommended the side option to make my pocketbook happy. I avoid carbs and the side was exactly perfect for what I needed for both nutritional value and size. My spouse got the house Gyro with chicken and Gyro as well. We arrived around 7 pm Nd they were in process of closing. Chairs were on tables, silverware etc restocked and they were mopping the floors. Staff was welcoming and kind and didn't make us feel like were in the way. I may give it another chance if I can get there earlier in the day. Would definitely not order the chicken again because it was fatty and dry. The food service area needed to be wiped up but things get messy when it's busy and perhaps they didn't have a chance to make it neat. The floor was sticky throughout the dining area despite watching it get mopped. Overall, the food was OK, the staff were kind and helpful.

detailedReviews.author: Kjersty Brady
detailedReviews.text: As always, we love the food at Padeli‚Äôs. My kids love the rice. It‚Äôs always a hit!

detailedReviews.author: Jay Wolf
detailedReviews.text: Good was good, service was good. I would give 5 stars BUT, they would not accept my cash as payment. I will NEVER eat here again because they do not accept cash. I pay cash everywhere I go.

detailedReviews.author: brandon issa
detailedReviews.text: I'm surprised that this place is never busy when I'm there, but the food is phenomenal.

detailedReviews.author: Brayden Cromar
detailedReviews.text: Greasy food. Boring atmosphere.

detailedReviews.author: N R
detailedReviews.text: Young man was mopping and handling the mopping bucket then without washing his hands started to make our food. The 3 of us left and let him know why we wouldnt be eating in hopes he would try to do better in the future. It's unfortunate and everyone was really nice. I just draw a line on mop/bucket to food contact. Food looked tasty though!

detailedReviews.author: Chase Martineau
detailedReviews.text: Fresh vegetables, flavorful rice, warm bread, would like slightly larger portions but nothing to complain about.

detailedReviews.author: Kristina Mecham
detailedReviews.text: Recently went here on a whim and thought it was so good! The portions were way bigger than I anticipated for the prices and everything was SO good!

detailedReviews.author: Stuart Roskelley
detailedReviews.text: Have been here many times and I've never been disappointed. The food is excellent, the staff is excellent, and the price is excellent.

detailedReviews.author: Denise Helin
detailedReviews.text: After a long day of highway driving I pulled in to my motel, which is in the neighborhood. I was craving something fresh and healthy and hearty and this place delivered! I had the half-and-half bowl which gave me a combination of Greek salad with generous fresh toppings as well as their lemon rice with chickpeas, and I added three huge fresh crispy falafel balls. It came with a huge fresh piece of pita bread which was freshly warmed and grilled. Really pleasant staff.

detailedReviews.author: Derick Marchant
detailedReviews.text: Like Cafe Rio, but for Greek food. The food was excellent!!! The sauces are incredible. The food was reasonably priced. Great quality. And the service was fantastic; everyone was so nice and let us sample sauces to make sure we got exactly what we wanted.

detailedReviews.author: Amber Worthen
detailedReviews.text: There‚Äôs other Greek food places that are much better. The food is mediocre, and not authentically Greek. If you need a quick bite for lunch, go for it, if you have time head somewhere else.

detailedReviews.author: Au Tism
detailedReviews.text: Such good food just so hard ordering the two boys servicing me were verry awkward and asked me a question but liek had a spasm like he on meth very unprofessional to me is all

detailedReviews.author: Senna S.
detailedReviews.text: I visited this place for the first time and ordered a gyro. The quality was average, too salty for my taste, and the meat didn‚Äôt seem as fresh as it should be. It‚Äôs a basic fast-food spot with a Greek-inspired menu, but nothing special. I don‚Äôt plan on returning.

detailedReviews.author: Jason Breindel
detailedReviews.text: Food was bland, did not spark joy.  Fry sauce was awesome!  Put fry sauce on your gyro and it definitely adds flavor.  Service is awesome!

detailedReviews.author: Jensen Le Sueur
detailedReviews.text: Place is clean and well managed.  everyone was friendly and working even during the slow period.  Our food was exactly what you could ask for with gyros. Good place to grab a bite. Recommended.

detailedReviews.author: Graham Oxborrow
detailedReviews.text:
We got their family pack. It includes 4 gyros and 4 servings of lemon rice. The toppings on the gyros are limited to 3 (for example, lettuce, tomatoes, and feta cheese) but there is quite a variety.

They have an assortment of meats to choose from. The beef and lamb is really good and what we always get.

For sauces, they have quite a few different ones including traditional tzatziki, creamy mustard, and spicy feta. We prefer the traditional tzatziki.

We also like to get a side of French fries to pair with the gyros.

detailedReviews.author: Heather Oxborrow
detailedReviews.text: We ordered the family pack. My gyro was the best I've had in a long time, the meat was amazing and everything tasted so fresh.

detailedReviews.author: Justice
detailedReviews.text: Very overpriced, chicken was good but fries were very dry and under seasoned,

detailedReviews.author: Jaren Graves
detailedReviews.text:
Good food. Been coming here for awhile now.

Came in an hour and a half before closing, and half the restaurant had the chairs put up and when I pulled them down to sit the employee told me the area was closed because they were preparing to close.
I offered to wipe the table and put the chairs up when we were done but they told me no,  go sit somewhere else... it was weird.

I left a 2 star previously, but it's been downgraded to a 1 star because of the owners responses to some of the other reviews.

detailedReviews.author: Alicia Alba
detailedReviews.text: What a great meal!  We got the family gyro meal pack and the portions were very generous. The gyros were great and the fries were some of the best I‚Äôve had. The falafel was fried fresh. I felt like the staff really went the extra mile in making sure everything was top quality, fresh, and perfect for us.

detailedReviews.author: Jesse Dotson
detailedReviews.text: So yummy in my tummy!

detailedReviews.author: Addi Lovell
detailedReviews.text: I‚Äôve only been to Greece once so I‚Äôm no expert but this is the most similar tasting to real Greek food I‚Äôve had in Utah. I loved it. Maybe I was just hungry, idk. But it was so good to me.

detailedReviews.author: Brett
detailedReviews.text: Place was gross - cafeteria style ‚ÄúGreek‚Äù fast food - order at the counter food was trash - save your money

detailedReviews.author: Shawn Brown
detailedReviews.text: I was pleased with the portion sizes and fair quality. The price was a little expensive though.

detailedReviews.author: paelino
detailedReviews.text: Priced really well, plus food was very good

detailedReviews.author: Ephraim Teo
detailedReviews.text: We‚Äôve been to the previous Greek restaurant in the same location we didn‚Äôt like it very well. Here we ordered the Padeli‚Äôs Gyto, Chopped Salad, Kid‚Äôs rice bowl. All very good! Tasty and fresh. Will come back!

detailedReviews.author: Chris Hardy
detailedReviews.text:
Refusing to accept cash should be illegal in the United States.  I also have a real problem with being charged $0.79 for a little extra cup of fry sauce.

The food was great, the restaurant was clean, and the staff was friendly.

detailedReviews.author: JD Christiansen
detailedReviews.text: These guys stuff the gyros!! Never had a bad experience. Great food!

detailedReviews.author: William Conner
detailedReviews.text: Don't accept cash for payment? Staggering.  Work hard to earn those dollars and chose to spend them on a good meal. However my money was rejected so will spend it elsewhere. Good luck.

detailedReviews.author: Porter Vuyk
detailedReviews.text: Employees are helpful. Food is good. Bring back cash payments.

detailedReviews.author: man pakman
detailedReviews.text:
Give 5 stars because of the servers here are so helpful and kind.

Food is alright the rice is too salty

detailedReviews.author: nay lay
detailedReviews.text: The food was pretty decent. Good price

detailedReviews.author: Kelela Sekona
detailedReviews.text: Gyro was ok. Fries were good.

detailedReviews.author: Kathleen Beal
detailedReviews.text: WoW came here with a friend on July 25.2024. We ordered food and decided to visit inside. They close at 8:30pm and there were other guests sitting near us. At 8:32pm as staff was cleaning It seems the person in charge with shoulder length hair announces We're Closed. Teasingly I said Oh you got our money and now you're kicking us out. His remarks were "Pretty Much Yeah" My teasing fun was met with rudeness and the feeling as a customer guest completely left me. Not a place I would return to under such poor republic relations from an employee that is in charge.

detailedReviews.author: Rebekah Wadsworth
detailedReviews.text: Delicious!!! So impressive!!!

detailedReviews.author: Brooklyn Mathews
detailedReviews.text: I got 2 olives. He gave me TWO olives on purpose. You get 3 toppings when you‚Äôre paying $10+ for a bowl. Feta cheese counts for a topping which is kind of dumb because then you‚Äôre left with some very lack luster fillings apparently. I just think it‚Äôs crazy that they give you a minuscule amount of toppings when you only get 3 of them. They gave me enough Taziki sauce to bathe in but no feta and TWO OLIVES. The dude was super rude and the food was fine. But I‚Äôll probably never go there again because $10 for a bowl of rice with some fancy sour cream on top is crazy. The drink setup was cool though.

detailedReviews.author: M A
detailedReviews.text: Don't waste your time, they don't even accept cash, the ambience is awkward and the place is always empty. There's much better options across town at a local restaurant.

detailedReviews.author: Ryan Echols
detailedReviews.text: Very tasty. You basically just tell them exactly what you want, kinda like subway or Cafe Rio.

detailedReviews.author: Kelly Jones
detailedReviews.text: The food is overpriced and not fresh- the lettuce and tomatoes aren‚Äôt and it makes the food taste bad. I ordered the bowl and they don‚Äôt let you have more than 3 toppings and THEY ARE SO CHEAP!!! They give you HALF A SPOONFUL of each of the toppings. The customer service is terrible. The people who work there are RUDE and forgetful about adding the pita to the meal that COMES WITH THE MEA.

detailedReviews.author: Taylor
detailedReviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with this place! The food was affordable and worth every penny. I had the street fries and loved them. The fries were made fresh and all the toppings were of excellent quality. The pita chips and hummus was also very good. Cool Greek spot in Lehi, I think I‚Äôll be back here again next time I need something light and fresh.

detailedReviews.author: Colby Webb
detailedReviews.text: Whoever was serving me the day I came in was awesome. I never leave tips for fast food places, but this guy really went above and beyond. I wish I knew his name.

detailedReviews.author: Athina Vakapuna
detailedReviews.text: Tried their Avgolemono for the first time and it is deeelicious!!!!! If you got the greek taste buds then this is the soup for your soul! üòãüòã how can I order a whole pot? Lol. No pic to add because i inhlaed it.

detailedReviews.author: Ayden Jensen
detailedReviews.text: I have no complaints, food and service are great!

detailedReviews.author: Patrick Ahrnsbrak
detailedReviews.text: Delicious

detailedReviews.author: Charles Candland
detailedReviews.text: On vacation to Utah and Idaho. Headed to a different restaurant while traveling. Saw Padeli's and came here instead. Glad we did. The food was really good and the people were great. Would return on another trip.

detailedReviews.author: Maryann Vu
detailedReviews.text:
Overall the place was good in regards to friendly staff and quick service.

Food was a different experience; I was not expecting my falafel to have feta cheese mixed in, pita bread that tasted like it wasn't fresh or made in-house, and yellow rice that reminded me of store bought boxed rice.

When I read "street food," I had high hopes for flavor and authenticity, but in comparison to the greek places I've had in the Chicagoland suburbs, it doesn't compete.  I was really hoping it would check the box for either healthy or street food greasy which it sadly did not.

detailedReviews.author: Mitchell Warner
detailedReviews.text: Food want great and the service was weird lady makes my food then has somebody else ring me out after standing around for a few minutes but my biggest complaint is the chairs!! This is a restaurant if you don‚Äôt care enough about your business to actually spend alittle money on decent chairs then why should I care? Of all things to be cheap with you choose chairs? I‚Äôm actually embarrassed to have eaten here and I‚Äôm more embarrassed for the owners being so cheap they choose to save alittle money on chairs. Not likely to be a successful business and I can‚Äôt say I feel bad for them cheap chairs bad service and bad food

detailedReviews.author: Meagan Wangsgard
detailedReviews.text: I am not exaggerating when I say this is the best food I had tasted in a while. Everything was fresh, flavors were incredible,service and atmosphere on point. This is my new favorite Greek restaurant, and I AM GREEK,haha. Can't wait to come back every time we visit Thanksgiving Point. Highly recommend!

detailedReviews.author: Pavel Panchekha
detailedReviews.text: The food is good and quite fresh and the prices are fair but basically Spitz is better on all fronts. So while I'm glad I went I probably will just go to Spitz next time.

detailedReviews.author: Patrick Hayden
detailedReviews.text: Food was amazing the lamb Gyro and the chicken gyro were so flavorful and had large portions of meat! The street style Greek fries were a whole meal and so delicious! They were really kind and attentive in taking orders! The baklava was stale but other than that will be returning!!

detailedReviews.author: Sea Dog (CJ)
detailedReviews.text: Whoever helped me at the front desk last Saturday when I went around one was super helpful super nice and awesome

detailedReviews.author: Ashley Rose
detailedReviews.text: My absolute favorite Greek restaurant!

detailedReviews.author: Shiloh Mcmillan
detailedReviews.text: You never disappoint

detailedReviews.author: C Pritchett
detailedReviews.text: Padeli‚Äôs near Thanksgiving Point in Lehi is a great place for Greek food in Utah County. Greek lemon rice and Greek salad with fresh pitas served quickly at the counter.

detailedReviews.author: Brooke LaBarr
detailedReviews.text: Delicious! Exceeded our expectations! We came in borderline hangry, but the staff were both really nice and helpful. Try the mustard sauce!

detailedReviews.author: Moses Lee
detailedReviews.text: Quality went down tremendously. Food quality went down. Atmosphere is heavy, like you can feel the oil in the air. Do they clean the soda machine? I doubt it. The workers can only do so much. I wont be returning

detailedReviews.author: Aaron Trapani
detailedReviews.text: We have eaten here a few times and we were excited to try it again. Unfortunately, the service has gone down hill. We walked in and the girl making the food seemed very upset that we even came in. She then used her gloved hand to adjust her ear bud. The same hand she then went on to prepare our food with. I quickly noticed all of the employees had earbuds in, no wonder nobody greeted us. There has to be some sort of Health Code that violates. To top it off, when we went to pay, she just pulled it up on the screen and then walked away. I payed and had to reach around the register to even grab my food. The food tasted good, but the service is what will keep us from returning in the future.

detailedReviews.author: Jay Que
detailedReviews.text:
The only reason I'm not giving a one-star review is because I've eaten here before several times during the day and the food was actually good. However, tonight was literally the most disgusting experience I've had at Padeli's and I will likely not be back. Maybe it's my fault for having arrived 30-40 minutes before closing. To start, we ordered our food, they didn't have enough rice for one of the bowls so they took my bowl to the back and filled it from who knows where. Then they added feta cheese to our bowl, but before doing so they noticed a spoon in the feta cheese container that shouldn't of been there and proceeded to take it out and put it where they believed it went, instead of grabbing a new utensil. Then I added an order of the pita chips and dip and asked for tzatziki sauce as the dip, which the had none left in the container, so they scraped the edges and bottom several times in order to fill one small dip container, that was ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING!!! Can't believe I still paid and tipped these two girls for this kind of service. Then to top it all off, the soda machine was off or not working and had to be reset in order for us to get one soft drink, all of this going on while they were cleaning around us and sweeping, which I understand it's close to closing time, but do you realize while you're sweeping, there are particles possibly from your entire shift going into the air and into our food and drink??? None the less we paid for our food but we are now up the road at Spitz where they actually have customers there and the service so far has been better.

EDIT: In response to the owners reply, it may have been "one instance" for me, but upon further review of reviews left by other customers, this definitely isn't the first time this has happened. Honestly I just hope this is something you discuss with your staff again to prevent any further returning customers from deciding to not come back due to this repeated type of incident.

detailedReviews.author: John Scott
detailedReviews.text: The food was very good.  I like the ability to have the basic gyro or modify it adding to it.  The gyros are quite large compared to other locations that I have been too.

detailedReviews.author: Ryan Averett
detailedReviews.text: This was really good Greek food the Beef & Lamb blend is really good and the souvlaki is fresh! The traditional sauce also has the right consistency and texture, not many places get that right! I would highly recommend this to anyone who likes Greek food.

detailedReviews.author: Thomas Laxson
detailedReviews.text:
All of the food is excellent. They emphasize letting you customize your dish, and all the choices are delicious.

I'm surprised that they aren't busier.

The restaurant is clean. There's plenty of parking because people don't seem to know how good this place is.

The service is okay. I've never seen the staff be friendly or cheerful, but they perform their duties efficiently.

detailedReviews.author: Matt S
detailedReviews.text: The best Greek food you will ever try

detailedReviews.author: Sam A
detailedReviews.text: Didn‚Äôt like the food at all. Falafel was under cooked. Chicken wrap was tasteless. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend

detailedReviews.author: Sariah Stone Fuller
detailedReviews.text:
I found my long-lost best friend!! I had no idea she was even missing, and yet here she is...in Padeli's!! When we were young we used to spend so much time together. And then I grew. I graduated to water. And I missed her! And now she's found! Best drink machine in the valley!!

Also, the falafels are top notch!

detailedReviews.author: Troy Davis
detailedReviews.text: Coolest kissing blue chairs this side of the Mississippi. And the falafel is decent too.

detailedReviews.author: Mason Neal
detailedReviews.text: Ransom was the best! He was awesome!

detailedReviews.author: Colin W (AnxiousNax)
detailedReviews.text: Got Spitz and then immediately ordered something from here to cleanse my pallet

detailedReviews.author: Ron Nordstrom
detailedReviews.text: Lehi location.  Excellent salads and gyros (wraps). Highly recommend this restaurant. Walking distance to many hotels

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customer opinions are divided. The 3.9/5 rating from 100 recent reviews suggests some great experiences mixed with areas needing attention.

strengthsPerceived: Customers consistently praise the fresh and delicious food with generous portions, making it a standout choice for Greek cuisine. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The relaxing atmosphere and excellent customer service create a memorable dining experience that keeps patrons returning. - review management can highlight this positive aspect

The variety and quality of sauces, along with the ability to sample them, are highly appreciated by customers, adding a unique touch to the dining experience. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this
improvementOpportunities: Negative reviews/reputation issues, including complaints about cash payment policy and hygiene practices - review management can address this concern
Lack of atmosphere/ambiance awareness and complaints about the dining experience being mediocre or boring - social media marketing can improve this area
Competition/discovery issues, with customers mentioning better alternatives and the food being mediocre - SEO services can solve this visibility issue

positive.author: Jamie Schaible
positive.text: This was our first time here and we had a great experience! The food was fresh and delicious with big portions. The customer service was top notch. We will definitely be back.

positive.author: Grant Echols
positive.text: Love the soup and rice bowl combo. I have been a semi-regular customer now for several years and just love the relaxing atmosphere and great service and food. Totally one of my favorites in the valley and especially for the Greek food.

neutral.author: Radical Edward
neutral.text: The ingredients were fresh and good quality. The actual meal was a bit lacking and bland, but not terrible. I would give it four stars, but the falafel I got was basically just raw batter inside of a crispy shell.

negative.author: Brice A
negative.text: Dont accept cash!!! They happily made our compleat order then threw it away in front of us because they don't accept cash .  So waste of time and food zero stars

negative.author: Jason V
negative.text: Did not provide the order I paid for.

negative.author: Kerisa Devey
negative.text: Very mediocre. Food lacked flavor and quality was mid. They also didn‚Äôt have ice which was a bummer.

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
